fair-value.title: Fair Value
fair-value.tooltip: The fair value represents the ratio at which users can stake/unstake one token. For reward-earning (rebasing) tokens, the value should always be 1 to 1 because user's wallet balance increase in a daily basis, simulating as such earned staking rewards.
fair-value.tooltip-aethc: The fair value represents the staking value of 1 aETHc, which should always increase and be above 1 ETH as ETH2 staking rewards are accumulated in Ankr's staking pool. At phase 1.5 of Ethereum 2.0, unstaking ETH will become possible and staked ETH can be redeemed at fair value.

table.name: Name
table.difference-tip: This indicates the difference between market price and fair value, which is the amount of tokens received when you stake/unstake.
table.est-price-tip: Price difference in comparison with the best price that you can get.

stats.apy-tooltip: Annual percentage yield (or APY) shows the rate of return you earn over a year including the effect of compounding.

faq.question-1: Which wallets are compatible with the aAVAXb/aAVAXc tokens?
faq.answer-1: aAVAXb/aAVAXc is an ERC-20 token that is compatible with Ethereum-based wallets like MetaMask.
faq.question-2: Are there any docs about the AVAX staking and how I set up my wallet etc.?
faq.answer-2: Yes — there is a user guide.
faq.question-3: What is the minimum amount of AVAX I can stake?
faq.question-4: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-4: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited.
faq.question-5: What is the unbonding period for aAVAXb/aAVAXc?
faq.answer-5: You receive the unstaked amount of AVAX after the end of the current validating period. A validating period is 4 weeks.
faq.answer-6:
aAVAXb is a rebasing token. When holding aAVAXb, your balance will increase in proportion to your AVAX staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your aAVAXb increase by a small amount.

aAVAXc is a reward-bearing token, meaning its quantity stays the same from the moment of staking. Instead, it appreciates in value, as the redemption ratio grows because of reward accumulation.
faq.question-7: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-7: aAVAXb will increase in number with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily. aAVAXc rewards are built into the token. Effectively, your rewards accumulate daily as aAVAXc grows in value to AVAX.
faq.question-8: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.question-9: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of aAVAXb?
faq.answer-9: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards.
faq.question-10: If I click Unstake, does my stake immediately stop accumulating rewards?
faq.answer-10: Your stake continues to accumulate rewards until the moment you receive them.
faq.question-11: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-11: The only risk for stakers is missing out on rewards during any time a validator they staked with is slashed. Slashing is a protocol-level penalty associated with a validator failure if it validates an invalid transaction, attacks the network, or goes offline. The delegated staked AVAX is not slashed — slashing impacts only the self-stake of the validator. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-12: Is there any liquidity for aAVAXb/aAVAXc anywhere currently?
faq.answer-12:
You can check all available DeFi platforms on ANKR DeFi:
  • aAVAXb
  • aAVAXc (coming soon)
You can also use your liquid tokens to:
  • Provide liquidity to DEXs and earn from commissions taken when users swap tokens, using the liquidity pool you're a part of.
  • Yield farm and earn additional rewards in the form of other tokens.
faq.question-13: Can I get staking metrics for my integration?
faq.answer-13: Yes, if you want to integrate Ankr Liquid Staking into your product, read Liquid Staking Metrics.

tooltips.you-will-get:
aAVAXb represents your staked AVAX plus accumulated staking rewards. Your wallet’s aAVAXb balance will grow daily to reflect earned rewards.

You can unstake it at fair value (1 aAVAXb = 1 AVAX) anytime after the unbonding period (1-28 days depending on validator's closest unlocking date).

unstake.timer: You will get your AVAX in: {duration}
unstake.timer-off: You will get your AVAX shortly

stake-avax.aavaxb-descr:
aAVAXb (reward earning) its quantity grows daily just being on your wallet. Redemption ratio is always:
1 aAVAXb=1 AVAX
stake-avax.aavaxc-descr:
aAVAXс (reward bearing) its quantity is stable, but redemption ratio grows daily.
Current rate is 1 aAVAXc={rate} AVAX

faq.question-1: Where can I find a detailed tutorial for BNB staking?
faq.answer-1: Yes - there’s a user guide you can find in the docs.
faq.question-2: What is the minimum amount of BNB I can stake?
faq.answer-2: {total} BNB: {minStake} BNB, plus the relayer fee — {relayerFee} BNB. You must also count in the gas fee on top for sending the transaction.
faq.question-3: Why do I get less aBNBc than aBNBb for my 1 BNB?
faq.answer-3: aBNBb is a rebasing token that changes in number, which is why we decided 1 aBNBb is equal to 1 BNB. However, aBNBc only changes in value, which is why the amount of aBNBc you get when staking is calculated by the formula stake * exchange_ratio. The exchange ratio is calculated like this: totals_supply_of_abnbc / (total_staked_bnb + total_rewards_for_staked_bnb - total_unstaked_abnbb_and_abnbc).
faq.question-4: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-4: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited.
faq.question-5: What is the unbonding period for aBNBb/aBNBc?
faq.answer-6:
aBNBb is a rebasing token. When holding aBNBb, your balance will increase in proportion to your BNB staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your aBNBb increase by a small amount.
aBNBc is a reward-bearing token, meaning its quantity stays the same from the moment of staking. Instead, it appreciates in value, as the redemption ratio grows because of reward accumulation.
faq.question-7: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-7: aBNBb will increase in number with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily. aBNBc will increase in value, daily.
faq.question-8: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.answer-8: ANKR does not charge any service fees for BNB Liquid Staking. However, validators charge a delegate stake fee, representing an indirect cost for liquid staking token holders: Ankr validator charges 2% from the rewards, BNB48 Club validator charges 0.48% from the rewards.
faq.question-9: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of aBNBb or appreciation of aBNBc?
faq.answer-9: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to and how much BNB is validated on the network. The less BNB is staked, the higher the rewards to incentivize more BNB to come online, and vice versa. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards.
faq.question-10: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-10: The only risk for stakers is missing out on rewards during any time a validator they staked with is “in jail” (slashed). Slashing is a protocol-level penalty associated with a validator failure if it validates an invalid transaction or goes offline. The delegated staked BNB is not slashed — slashing impacts only the self-stake of the validator. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-11: Is there any liquidity for aBNBb/aBNBc anywhere currently?
faq.answer-11:
You can check all available DeFi platforms on ANKR DeFi:
- aBNBb
- aBNBc (coming soon)

You can also use your liquid tokens to:
  • Provide liquidity to DEXs and earn from commissions taken when users swap tokens, using the liquidity pool you're a part of.
  • Yield farm and earn additional rewards in the form of other tokens.
faq.question-12: If I click Unstake, does my stake immediately stop accumulating rewards?
faq.answer-12: Your stake immediately stops accumulating rewards once you clicked Unstake.

aBNBb (reward earning) its quantity grows daily just being on your wallet. Redemption ratio is always:
1 aBNBb=1 BNB
stake-bnb.abnbc-descr:
aBNBс (reward bearing) its quantity is stable, but redemption ratio grows daily.
Current rate is 1 aBNBc={rate} BNB

stake-polygon-dashboard.title: MATIC Liquid Staking
stake-polygon-dashboard.unstake-eta: You will receive MATIC in about 3-4 days.

tooltip.apy:
The Annual Percentage Yield (APY) represents the average annualized earned MATIC over the last 7 days, net of delegation fees from Polygon Validator nodes.

Ankr Staking fee is 0%.

When there are at least 300 pending MATIC rewards, earned MATIC will be staked to generate compounding effect.
tooltip.fee: As unstaking MATIC tokens is a gas and time consuming process requiring sending several transactions to the MATIC smart-contracts deployed in Ethereum, Ankr Staking covers the gas fee cost and charge a modest fee in Ankr to compensate its expenses.  MATIC tokens will therefore be transfered to your wallet automatically as soon as unstake process is completed without any subsequent additional costs.

validation.is-not-enough-fee: {value} ANKR is not enough for unstaking fee. Please, buy ANKR

stake-polygon.stake-info: Stake at least 1 MATIC on Ethereum network and claim the same amount of aMATICb liquid staking tokens (aMATICb) on Ethereum network (ERC-20 token). Your aMATICb balance will increase on a daily basis, simulating as such your aMATICb staking rewards.
stake-polygon.matic-tooltip-body:
aMATICb grows daily just being in your wallet. It represents your staked MATIC plus accumulated staking rewards.

It can be redeemed at fair value 1 aMATICb = 1 MATIC anytime after 3-4 days unbonding period.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.question-1: How can I set up my wallet and stake MATIC?
faq.answer-1: Check the Stake MATIC user guide.
faq.question-2: What is the minimum amount of MATIC I can stake?
faq.question-3: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-3: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited.
faq.question-4: What is the unbonding period for aMATICb/aMATICc?
faq.answer-4: 80 epochs and more depending on the network congestion. Typically, it takes around 1–2 days to receive your unstaked MATIC.
faq.answer-5:
aMATICb is a rebasing token. When holding aMATICb, your balance will increase in proportion to your MATIC staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your aMATICb increase by a small amount.

aMATICc is a reward-bearing token, meaning its quantity stays the same from the moment of staking. Instead, it appreciates in value, as the redemption ratio grows because of reward accumulation.
faq.question-6: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-6:
aMATICb rewards arrive in your wallet with every rebase. Rebasing occurs daily.

aMATICc rewards are built into the token. Effectively, your rewards accumulate daily as aMATICc grows in value to MATIC.
faq.question-7: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.answer-7: When unstaking, the user pays a fee in ANKR that starts from 100 ANKR. Typical fee range is 500–3500 ANKR.
faq.question-8: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of aMATICb?
faq.answer-8: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to and how much MATIC is validated on the network. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards.
faq.question-9: If I click Unstake, does my stake immediately stop accumulating rewards?
faq.answer-9: Your stake continues to accumulate rewards until the moment you receive them.
faq.question-10: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-10: The only risk for stakers is missing out on rewards during any time a validator they staked with is slashed. Slashing is a protocol-level penalty associated with a validator failure if it validates an invalid transaction or goes offline. The delegated staked MATIC is not slashed — slashing impacts only the self-stake of the validator. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-11: Is there any liquidity for aMATICb/aMATICc anywhere currently?
faq.answer-11:
You can check all available DeFi platforms on ANKR DeFi:
  • aMATICb
  • aMATICc (coming soon)
You can also use your liquid tokens to:
  • Provide liquidity to DEXs and earn from commissions taken when users swap tokens, using the liquidity pool you're a part of.
  • Yield farm and earn additional rewards in the form of other tokens.
faq.question-12: Can I get staking metrics for my integration?
faq.answer-12: Yes, if you want to integrate Ankr Liquid Staking into your product, read Liquid Staking Metrics.

aFTMb grows daily just being in your wallet. It represents your staked FTM plus accumulated staking rewards.

It can be redeemed at fair value 1 aFTMb = 1 FTM anytime after 3-4 days unbonding period.

faq.question-1: Which wallets are compatible with the aFTMb/aFTMc tokens?
faq.answer-1: aFTMb/aFTMc is an ERC-20 token that is compatible with Ethereum-based wallets like MetaMask.
faq.question-2: Are there any docs about the FTM staking and how I set up my wallet etc.?
faq.answer-2: Yes — there is a user guide.
faq.question-3: What is the minimum amount of FTM I can stake?
faq.question-4: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-4: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited.
faq.question-5: What is the unbonding period for aFTMb/aFTMc?
faq.answer-5: You receive the unstaked amount after the unbonding period of up to {days} days.
faq.answer-6:
aFTMb is a rebasing token. When holding aFTMb, your balance will increase in proportion to your FTM staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your aFTMb increase by a small amount.

aFTMc is a reward-bearing token, meaning its quantity stays the same from the moment of staking. Instead, it appreciates in value, as the redemption ratio grows because of reward accumulation.
faq.question-7: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-7: aFTMb will increase with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily. aFTMc rewards are built into the token. Effectively, your rewards accumulate daily as aFTMc grows in value to FTM.
faq.question-8: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.answer-8: When unstaking, users pay a burn fee that depends on the current liquidity and amount to unstake.
faq.question-9: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of aFTMb?
faq.answer-9: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards.
faq.question-10: If I click Unstake, does my stake immediately stop accumulating rewards?
faq.answer-10: Your stake immediately stops accumulating rewards once you clicked Unstake.
faq.question-11: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-11:
If a validator node acts maliciously, delegators will also be slashed as this is an essential part of the Fantom network’s security.
Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-12: Is there any liquidity for aFTMb anywhere currently?
faq.answer-12:
• aFTMb
  • aFTMc (coming soon)
You can also use your liquid tokens to:
  • Provide liquidity to DEXs and earn from commissions taken when users swap tokens, using the liquidity pool you're a part of.
  • Yield farm and earn additional rewards in the form of other tokens.
faq.question-13: Can I get staking metrics for my integration?
faq.answer-13: Yes, if you want to integrate Ankr Liquid Staking into your product, read Liquid Staking Metrics.

stake-ethereum.unclaimed-descr: Your unclaimed staked ETH balance will be converted to {token} on top of the selected amount of ETH to be staked.
stake-ethereum.unstake-tooltip: Unstaking will be enabled after The Merge of 'Eth1' and 'Eth2' into a single chain and withdrawal activation. Expected ~Q3/Q4 2022.

faq.question-1: Where can I find a detailed tutorial for ETH staking?
faq.answer-1: Yes - there’s a user guide you can find in the docs.
faq.question-2: What is the minimum amount of ETH I can stake?
faq.question-3: What is the change interval to increase my stake?
faq.answer-3: {step} ETH. It means you can stake {step}, {stepx2}, {stepx3} ETH, but cannot stake, for example, 0.55, 1.1, 1.88 ETH.
faq.question-4: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-4: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited. You should know that currently staking starts once 32 ETH are accumulated, so if your stake is >32 ETH, it’ll be divided into chunks and the rule will apply to each of them.
faq.question-5: What is the unbonding period for aETHb/aETHc?
faq.answer-5: Currently, there is no unbonding period, as there is no unstaking for ETH. Unstaking will be enabled after The Merge of 'Eth1' and 'Eth2' into a single chain and withdrawal activation. Expected ~Q3/Q4 2022.
faq.answer-6:
aETHb is a rebasing token. When holding aETHb, your balance will increase in proportion to your ETH staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your aBNBb increase by a small amount.
aETHc, though, does not change in quantity but will appreciate in value, daily.
Mind that to pull out your rewards, you’ll need to sell aETHb/aETHc on Ankr DeFi, as Ethereum hasn’t implemented the unstaking functionality yet.
faq.question-7: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-7: aETHb will increase with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily. aETHc will increase in value only, daily.
faq.question-8: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.answer-8: ANKR does not charge any service fees for ETH Liquid Staking. However, validators charge a fee deducted from your rewards (Ankr’s validator node charges 10%), representing an indirect cost for liquid staking token holders. Ankr's income comes from running one of the several validator nodes that will be used to stake ETH.
faq.question-9: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of aETHb or appreciation of aETHc?
faq.answer-9: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to and how much ETH is validated on the network. The less ETH is staked, the higher the rewards to incentivize more ETH to come online, and vice versa. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards. View the current amount of staked ETH.
faq.question-10: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-10: The only risk for stakers is missing out on rewards during any time a validator they staked with is slashed. Slashing is a protocol-level penalty associated with a validator failure if it validates an invalid transaction or goes offline. The delegated staked ETH is not slashed — slashing impacts only the self-stake of the validator. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-11: Is there any liquidity for aETHb/aETHc anywhere currently?
faq.answer-11:
You can check all available DeFi platforms and options on ANKR DeFi.

You can also use your liquid tokens to:
  • Provide liquidity to DEXs and earn from commissions taken when users swap tokens, using the liquidity pool you're a part of.
  • Yield farm and earn additional rewards in the form of other tokens.

switcher.title: ANKR Switch
switcher.info: Switch Reward Bearing and Reward Earning Liquid Staking

tooltips.aETHb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked ETH (aETHb) is a rebasing token. When holding aETHb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your ETH2 staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aETHb vs. ETH is always 1:1.
tooltips.aETHc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked ETH (aETHc) is a reward-bearing token.Its value compared with ETH represents the redemption value of aETHc, increasing over time to reflect ETH2 staking rewards earned.
tooltips.aBNBb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked BNB (aBNBb) is a rebasing token. When holding aBNBb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your BNB staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aBNBb vs. BNB is always 1:1.
tooltips.aBNBc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked BNB (aBNBc) is a reward-bearing token. Its value compared with BNB represents the redemption value of aBNBc, increasing over time to reflect BNB staking rewards earned.
tooltips.aMATICb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked MATIC (aMATICb) is a rebasing token. When holding aMATICb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your MATIC staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aMATICb vs. MATIC is always 1:1.
tooltips.aMATICc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked MATIC (aMATICc) is a reward-bearing token. Its value compared with MATIC represents the redemption value of aMATICc, increasing over time to reflect MATIC staking rewards earned.
tooltips.pendingTx: This may take a moment; you can close this window. Once completed you can check out your new {token} exposure on the Ankr Staking Dashboard.

unstake-dialog.title: How many {token} do you want to redeem?
unstake-dialog.unstake-fee-tooltip: As unstaking MATIC tokens is a gas and time consuming process requiring sending several transactions to the MATIC smart contracts deployed in Ethereum. Ankr Staking covers all gas fees while charging users a modest fee in ANKR tokens to compensate expenses. MATIC tokens will be transferred to your wallet automatically when the unstaking process is complete with no additional costs.

dashboard.title: Stakable tokens
dashboard.amount-tooltip: Amount of staked token, plus accumulated reward.
dashboard.amount-usd-tooltip: Amount of staked token, plus accumulated reward / USD equivalent.
dashboard.claim-tooltip: Get liquid staking tokens to your Ethereum wallet
dashboard.old-version-tooltip:
We are decommissioning an older version of the aETHc liquid staking token on the BNB chain and switching to a new aETHc token that will be compatible with Ankr Bridge.

To switch your aETHc to the new version, click the “Switch” button and confirm the action in your wallet.

The process will take a few seconds, after which the new tokens will be displayed on your dashboard.
dashboard.usd-tooltip: USD equivalent of staked token and accumulated reward.
dashboard.willTakeUnstake: It takes about {days} days to unstake

guard.title: Please connect your wallet to continue

token-info.title: What is {token}?
token-info.aAVAXb:
aAVAXb represents your staked AVAX and provides liquidity for your staked position.

aAVAXb balance in your wallet grows daily to reflect the earned rewards.

Redemption ratio is always 1 aAVAXb = 1 AVAX.

You can unstake it anytime and receive your stake and earned rewards after the 1–28 days unbonding period, depending on validator's closest unlocking date.

While staking, you can also use aAVAXb for trading and other DeFi opportunities.
token-info.aAVAXc:
aAVAXc represents your staked FTM and provides liquidity for your staked position.

All staking rewards are built into the token price, and aAVAXc grows daily in value, but never in number.

Redemption ratio now is 1 aAVAXc = {ratio} AVAX.

You can unstake it anytime and receive your stake and earned rewards after the ~1–28 days unbonding period, depending on validator's closest unlocking date.

While staking, you can also use aAVAXc for trading and other DeFi opportunities.
token-info.aBNBb:
aBNBb represents your staked BNB and provides liquidity for your staked position.

aBNBb balance in your wallet grows daily to reflect the earned rewards.

Redemption ratio is always 1 aBNBb = 1 BNB.

You can unstake it anytime and receive your stake and earned rewards after the ~7–15 days unbonding period.
While staking, you can also use aBNBb for trading and other DeFi opportunities.

You can unstake it anytime and receive your stake and earned rewards after the ~7–15 days unbonding period.
While staking, you can also use aBNBc for trading and other DeFi opportunities.
token-info.aETHb:
aETHb represents your staked ETH and provides liquidity for your staked position.

aETHb balance in your wallet grows daily to reflect the earned rewards.

Redemption ratio is always 1 aETHb = 1 ETH.

You can redeem your aETHb for ETH and rewards when Ethereum 2.0 enters the 1.5 phase and implements the unstaking functionality.

While staking, you can also use aETHb for trading and other DeFi opportunities.

tooltips.polkadot: To connect to the Polkadot wallet, please connect to one of the Ethereum compatible networks first

main.title: Ankr Bridge
main.fee-banner: You will need a small gas fee (of native token) to claim

banner.footer: Please only send your assets to wallets like MetaMask that allow you to control your private keys! Do not send your assets to crypto exchanges as they may be lost in the process

tx.close-notification: Please do not close the window until the operation is completed

description.connect-wallet: Connect a wallet that is linked with the destination blockhain
description.progress: You are sending {token} to the bridge smart contract. After completed, you will able to claim {token} on {network} network.
description.submit-receive: Submit receive transaction to finish your transfer

restore.title: Finish Bridge
restore.note: To complete the bridging process, please enter the transaction ID of the deposit transaction on the initial network

error.wrong-transaction: This is not a deposit transaction. Please enter deposit transaction hash

total-info.claimable-tooltip: You can restake or claim your earned rewards for completed epochs only.

how-it-works.description: Independent node providers serve blockchain requests from developers, dApps, games, and other sources. But to serve traffic, node providers need a substantial amount of ANKR deposited or ‘staked’ to their nodes to ensure they behave properly and keep within high performance requirements. Earn staking rewards by helping node providers meet the collateral requirements to participate in the protocol.
how-it-works.article-1: Choose a node that matches your risk tolerance. Newer nodes with a smaller staked pool and shorter history on the protocol may have higher APYs but could have more potential for performance issues and slashing, which means missed rewards. Conversely, longstanding providers may offer more modest APYs as rewards are split between more stakers, but less risk is involved.
how-it-works.article-2: After choosing your preferred node, select ‘Stake’ and connect your wallet containing ANKR. Then choose the amount of ANKR you would like to stake.
how-it-works.article-3: Receive staking rewards directly to independent wallets such as MetaMask. You are able to check your staked balance and rewards on the dashboard at any time or unstake your ANKR.
how-it-works.info: Earn staking rewards by helping node providers meet the collateral requirements to participate in the protocol.

empty-state.start-description: Stake ANKR tokens directly to node providers on Ankr Protocol.
empty-state.description-1: Earn ANKR for facilitating Web3 development
empty-state.description-2: Stake to Full Nodes for the first time ever
empty-state.description-4: Earn participation in ANKR DAO governance
